entries.content: When a prospect indicates disinterest, don't freak out. Stay calm and continue the conversation.
So you genuinely don't have to look for new customers?
entries.notes: A soft probe to confirm stated disinterest and understand the current state.

entries.content: Any plans to [relevant topic] in the near future?
entries.notes: Probing for potential future need or timing issues.

entries.content: I get the feeling you're happy with the level of business you got, no plans to grow it or increase it?
entries.notes: Probing current satisfaction and future aspirations when disinterest is shown.

entries.content: I can call back when you're settled into your new premises.
entries.notes: Offering to reconnect later if timing is the reason for disinterest.

entries.content: Have you closed your mind to the possibility that it doesn't have to be this way?
entries.notes: A direct, yet soft, probe to diagnose if disinterest stems from a fixed mindset or belief.

entries.content: So what you're saying basically is, even if you saw something you believed could work, you're just at a stage where you're not wanting to try it?
entries.notes: Diagnosing if resistance is due to skepticism about the solution or unwillingness to change/try.

entries.content: Let's pretend you genuinely believed I could help... would you throw me out or do what at all further?
entries.notes: A hypothetical probe to test the depth of resistance or disinterest.

entries.content: Sometimes, you meet people who have problems but have closed their mind to wanting to do it differently.
entries.notes: Recognizing deep-seated resistance as a form of disinterest that's difficult to overcome.

entries.content: Just because you have a solution and someone needs it doesn't mean it's going to go through.
entries.notes: Accepting that not all prospects, even those with problems, are ready or willing to buy.

entries.content: After probing and confirming deep disinterest or unwillingness to change, accept the answer and move on gracefully.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
